name: Hanoi City Palace Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From our initial internet contact to the final goodbye the staff at The Elegance 3 were a joy to meet, they were wonderfully friendly are helpful. The hotel itself is a gem, an oasis of tranquility located in the heart of the Old Quarter of Ha Noi.
reviews.title: This hotel is an absolute gem

likes.liked: — The staff, the decor,the service, the relaxing atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were the equal of those served in 5 star hotels elsewhere in the world and the rooms are better appointed; how many hotels provide a computer with free internet facilities.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The staff booked us a very reasonably priced, very enjoyable, not to be missed, 3 day, 2 night cruise to World Heritage Ha Long Bay.
reviews.title: Excellent Elegance

likes.disliked: — No issues - especially considering the cost

reviews.text: In conclusion, if you are going to Ha Noi do not consider staying anywhere but Elegance 3.
reviews.title: Can't say enough good things!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, internet in rooms, breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the suites and it was just like the pictures on display in the hotels's website which was reassuring. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast (included) was a great start to the day as it offered several choices (fruit, eggs, toast, croissant etc). Other advantages to staying here include the fact there's an ATM right outside the hotel entrance, it's a good location in the Old Quarter being a short stroll to a lot of sights like Hoan Kiem Lake and the Water Puppets. In fact, I'd suggest you book your tickets to the Water Puppets thru the hotel's front desk as the shows sell out very quickly and there's often a queue.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in Hanoi

reviews.text: Every aspect of my stay was superb. Excellent, excellent service and hospitality makes it shine.
reviews.title: Great value on every level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel: modern, boutique style: beautifully designed and clean to a fault. Free internet access in the lobby and in the rooms. It has the best, simple alarm clock I've had in all of Vietnam!
reviews.title: a true Hanoi gem!

reviews.text: Location: in the heart of Old Quarter, near the Lake and within walking distance of just about everything you'd want to do in that part of Hanoi.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend!

likes.liked: — Great staff, clean, quiet, comfortable, affordable
likes.disliked: — Difficult to make the deposit--had to use Western Union

reviews.text: Service and amenities : Great breakfast (included); dry cleaning returned the same day in impeccable condition; timely room service delivered from local restaurants; good local coffee in room.
reviews.title: Don't waste your time looking further.......

likes.liked: — So clean, great value, great location.

reviews.text: I could not be more pleased with how gracious and accomodating the staff was in helping me plan and execute some free time I had in Hanoi. Nothing I asked of them was too difficult. Plus, they made my stay really fun!
reviews.title: The hotel I would love to pack in my suitcase and take with me!

reviews.text: The room was very comfortable. We loved having a computer with internet access right in the room. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. They helped us arrange for excellent drivers and guides on several occasions, and this resulted in wonderful experiences and a chance to learn a great deal about Hanoi and Vietnamese culture and life generally. The location is also excellent.
reviews.title: Hanoi Elegance 3 is a great place to stay!

likes.disliked: — Breakfast (few options compared to other hotels in Viet Nam)

reviews.text: From our very first contact with this hotel we knew we were going to be looked after. They picked us up at the airport and the hotel staff were so welcoming. Our rooms were spacious and very clean. Internet access (if a little slow), flat screen tv and fresh fruit. A welcome drink and lots of smiles.
reviews.title: Believe all the good reviews

likes.disliked: — the only fault was a slow breakfast

reviews.text: The location is great, easy to find. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I think we preferred it to Elegance 4, just a touch! Easier to locate and maybe a little friendlier. The breakfast was good but a little slow.
reviews.title: a practical comparison

likes.disliked: — some staff were sulky, and we wondered if there was some ageism shown towards certain guests

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for value, don't stay in a generic expensive hotel chain when you can have character and charm for a third of the cost.
reviews.title: A great hotel in Hanoi

likes.disliked: — Nothing to complain about other than the breakfast which was just adequate

reviews.title: Dealing with Elegance 3
reviews.text: The staff stored our luggage whilst we went to Halong Bay, nothing was too much trouble. Do yourselves a favour and stay with Elegance 3 (or4)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This being somewhat the luck of the draw as it was our first visit to Hanoi, we were impressed beyond our best expectations at the level of service and the atmosphere of the Hanoi Elegance 3. The staff was unbelievably helpful,courteous, and friendly. The excellence didn't end with the staff.... the property was beautiful and very well-appointed. Breakfast every morning was terrific and the food & beverage folks were great at accomodating any sort of special requests.....got to love their coffee!
reviews.title: Absolutely Hanoi's BEST

reviews.text: There is no question where we'll stay the next time we're in Hanoi!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at HE3 in late November. The hotel is in a good location in the heart of the old quarter. Its clean and comfortable with pleasant staff always willing to help with any needs. The superior double room wasn't large by western standards, but was big enough to move around in. The bathroom was big, but the shower was tiny and had a funky smell. The computer in the room was a nice touch, with speedy (for Vietnam) internet service.
reviews.title: Pleasant experience

reviews.text: HE3 offered a great breakfast each morning, with a number of choices and fresh ingredients. The hotel was also willing to store our bags overnight after we checked out in case we didn't want to bring them to Halong Bay.
reviews.title: Unbeatable service!!!

likes.disliked: — not enough rooms to keep up with demand!

reviews.text: HE3 was a nice hotel. A bit expensive comparatively to other Hanoi hotels, but overall a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: great hotel!

description: Best boutique hotel in the Old Quarter of Hanoi, with modern facilities served by a team of professional & dedicated team, providing you a comfortable & memorable stay.
